TopicTitle: [Request] JetCat P300 Rx Enginge Part - Turbo Rocket

Articles.Content:
Hello, I would like to ask someone to make this engine so that I can test a project that I am working on to make a vehicle that arrives (initially) at 3000 meters altitude and uses this engine. [Translate by google translate from pt-BR]

Engine: [Jet-Cat P300RX]( http://modelaircraftcompany.com/newshop/en/home/86-jetcat-p300-rx.html)

This single shaft Turbine is equiped with a radial compressor ,diffusor , combution chamber , turbine and Exhaust nose.

RX will say, digital controled with intergated fuel valve , intergrated power bus for a single connection to ECU V10.0 , only one correction for the fuel line , intergated Kero start and a starter

External the Fuel pump and Lipo battery.

Technical data :

Idle RPM: 35.000 R/min

Max. RPM 106.000 R/min

Idle Thrust 14 N

Max Thrust 300 N

Exhaust temperture 480-750 Celsius

Pressure rate 3,55

Mass stream 0,5 kg /sec

Jet blast speed 2160 km/h

Jet performance 90 KW

Fuel consumption at max RPM 980 ml /min

Fuel consumption at iddle RPM 179 ml/min

SFC@ max RPM 0,157 Kg/Nh

Weight incl valve and starter 2.630 gram

Outer diameter 132 mm

Length 365 mm

Fuel J-A1 or parafine with 5% turbine oil Aero Shell 500 or BP 2380

 

[PDF](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1dUfhoRmhs_QuZwWZGmauKoXqan7qdHBE/view?usp=sharing)
[cefast.com.br](http://www.cefast.com.br/)
[gedai.cefetmg.br](http://www.gedai.cefetmg.br/)

Especificações do veículo:
MTOW: 14 kg
EW: 13 kg
Take off thrust: 900 N
Cruise thrust: 300 N to 200 N
Max speed: 150 m/s
Burning time: 25 sec
Coasting time: 11 sec
Max altitude: 3 km

Kerbal Space Program 1.8.1.2694
Programação:
-C#
-kRPC
-Arduino
-Visual Studio 2019
-(Futuro: Redes Neurais)
-CFD (Computational Fluid Dynamics)

PC:
Processor: Intel(R) Core(TM) i3-8100 CPU @ 3.60GHz
 Video Card: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 1060 3GB
 RAM: 8.0 GB
 Operating System: Windows 10
Storage: HDD 1.0 TB

Mod Pack "Simulator":

Spoiler

Advanced Jet Engine (AdvancedJetEngine v2.15.0)
ASET Agency  (ASETAgency 1.0)
ASET Props (ASETProps 1.5)

Real Solar System (RealSolarSystem v18.0)

How sophisticated a mod do we need this to be? Does it need accurate models or just rough shape and performance? It looks like you have RealFuels and SolverEngines. Can I see what the CFG file of a functional engine looks like in your modpack?

 

It looks like you're trying to use this for simulating a real aircraft design. I've modeled Jetcat engines before in KSC but it was a much less exact science. Just resizing Junos and intakes and adjusting their performance until it fit reality.

Edited June 21, 2020 by Pds314

First, thank you very much for responding. Second, I'm sorry for the delay in responding and for my English generated by the google translator. So..

As realistic as possible, I want to use the game as a simulator of the real project. But I'm still looking at how I'm going to do that.

I really don't know how to answer that, but as far as I can think I need the engine to have the same dimensions, mass, fuel consumption and thrust as the original.

I had used CKAN (mod manager) to build the modpack, I didn't like the result... Slow game play, giant loading screens, mods not working properly.

I followed this tutorial on YT, it installs the following mods: 

Spoiler

https://imgur.com/NOd9Hso

Then I added the following mods:

Spoiler

https://imgur.com/5MUvjl3

https://imgur.com/iW3ckRa

Now the game is realistic, beautiful and running smooth.


I didn't change any .cfg, they are all in the version of the last realease (ref date: 24/jun/2020) from github and compatible with KSP 1.8.1.


Yes, it is a real aircraft design: 

Spoiler

https://imgur.com/feT2WmM

 

 

Edited June 26, 2020 by Arthur Marcolino

@Arthur Marcolino I took your request as a challenge and modeled that engine for myself. Most of its stats don't mean anything to me as far as my knowledge and play style of KSP go. (Note that I don't use RO, AJE and the various realism mods.) The stats I did manage to capture or otherwise apply, much of which through guess work are:

  • 130kg mass
  • Size: 0.3125m diameter "Mk0"
  • Cruising speed of Mach 0.49 at 3km altitude (the target mach number was 0.468)
  • 14 kN thrust and 2850s impulse so that it starts off at using 0.5 kg of LiquidFuel per second.
  • Includes a slow blade spin animation
  • Includes working heat emissive animation.

You'll have to find someone to re-calibrate the engine for you if you don't know how to do it yourself, but you have a shiny new dedicated engine for your enjoyment.

You can download it here and consider it Unlicensed /Share Alike/ Free for all.

Album (has more screenshots)

MY HEAVEN GOD, WHAT A BEAUTIFUL THING I DON'T BELIEVE <- that was my reaction kkkkkk

I'm sorry for the delay in responding, I forgot this post because I didn't believe anyone was going to do it. I was watching a Saturn V documentary now and I remembered. I also don't understand much of the numbers that I put there, I just copied it from the engine manufacturer's website. The numbers that matter to me are the diameter, height and power. In the images that I put there is a real model of the rocket. The real rocket is 2.5 meters long and uses a pet bottle as a fuel tank. So I just need a 300 N engine versus the 14 kN you did. But I am completely impressed with the model you made, it is identical to the original. I will try to learn how to modify the dimensions, power and fuel consumption. Can you refer me to a website or video to help me do this?

VERY VERY VERY THANK YOU!!
I do not know how to thank.

powered by google translator
